channel.title: Need help with my gateway... -READ-
channel.description:
I load it up, yeah i know how to do it, im not a willy head.
i do run>lil box comes up>i type in 'ipconfig'> it loads up> then it freezes/closes down> i try getting a screen pic of what it says, but i have bad timing
tell me what to do to make it load up so i can at least get screen pic of it?
all i want to do is get my NO-IP up, but i need my gateway to do it -.-
im using god of's tut. the stickied tut of his

item.title: Need help with my gateway... -READ-
item.dc:creator: @pies pies
item.description:
@pies wrote:

Your PATH variable has got mangled. This is the second time in as many weeks that I have seen this happen, and both times it was a Java program folder that was in the mangled variable. I wonder why that is? Possibly a bug. Java for 64-bit Windows certainly has a known bug in the installer that can do this.

Anyway, never mind. Luckily it’s quite simple to fix.

Here’s how to put things right

  1. Right click My Computer, choose properties.
  2. Choose Advanced tab.
  3. Click on Environment Variables button.
  4. in the System Variables (lower part) Highlight PATH. (You have to scroll down)
  5. Click the Edit button.
  6. The “Edit System variable” dialog comes up.
  7. The whole PATH string will be highlighted. Hit the END key to unhighlight it and position the typing cursor at the end.
  8. Type a semicolon ( ; ) at the end so it reads like this

C:\Program Files\Java\jre1.6.0_02\bin;

  1. Copy this whole line to the clipboard (the one below)

C:\Windows\System32;C:\Windows;C:\Windows\System32\Wbem

  1. Paste it at the end of your PATH so it looks like this

C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_01\bin;C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_01\bin;C:\Windows\System32;C:\Windows;C:\Windows\System32\Wbem

  1. OK three times to come right out.

  2. Reboot

  3. Check PATH looks like above.[br][size=1]Posted on: October 03, 2007, 06:42:22 PM[/size][hr]This will definalty work because I had the same problem a while back…

Glad to help

Read full topic
